title: AUDIO: Top BBC presenters beg Robert Peston to stay
text:
Top BBC presenters beg Robert Peston to stay 2 October   20:37 BST 
Robert Peston should stay at the BBC, and reject a reported offer to become ITV's political editor, according to a string of BBC presenters. 
The corporation's Director General Tony Hall is said to be offering the economics editor Newsnight presenting slots. 
The BBC's Eddie Mair told the audience of Radio 4's PM programme: "The very suggestion of Robert wanting to leave the BBC makes me want to cry my eyes out, literally. 
"I want to publicly offer to stand aside as presenter of PM and offer my job to Robert as part of his burgeoning portfolio of programmes. I'm also prepared to sell my kidney if it in increases the amount of money the BBC can afford to offer." 
He then went on to ask Huw Edwards, Nicholas Parsons and Jonathan Dimbleby what they would do to entice Mr Peston to stay.
